# vistool

<!-- badges: start -->
[![r-cmd-check](https://github.com/slds-lmu/vistool/actions/workflows/r-cmd-check.yaml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/slds-lmu/vistool/actions/workflows/r-cmd-check.yaml)
<!-- badges: end -->

The goal of `vistool` is to visualize optimization traces and aid in teaching optimization-related concepts.

`vistool` helps you:
- explore loss landscapes and objective functions in one or two dimensions;
- inspect optimization runs for gradient descent variants;
- communicate model behavior with publication-ready plots.

## Get started

Installation steps, optional Python requirements, and hands-on examples now live in the “Getting started” vignette:
- Local: `vignette("vistool", package = "vistool")`
- Online: <https://slds-lmu.github.io/vistool/articles/vistool.html>

The vignette walks through package setup, plotly surface rendering, and a complete mlr3-based workflow.

## Contributing

For anyone interested in contributing to `vistool`, please see the [Developer reference](DEVELOPMENT.md).
